intro: Merostachys pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered grass, is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing perennial grass characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces pale green to golden yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a smooth texture and a bluish-green hue. Merostachys pauciflora is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or grasslands.
